Authors: Moniaga J., Tansil B.Y.A., Sasmoko, Indrianti Y., Noerlina
Title: The Influence of User Experience Playerunknown's Battlegrounds Game Toward Adaptive Learning
Source title: Proceeding - 2019 International Conference of Artificial Intelligence and Information Technology, ICAIIT 2019
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara Universiy, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Moniaga, J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Tansil, B.Y.A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sasmoko, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Indrianti, Y., Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara Universiy, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Noerlina, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: the development of games that are increasingly rapid by itself has produced a variety of works that are in great demand by game players. PlayerUnknown's Battleground (PUBG) is one of the best-selling examples of games downloaded in early 2018. This study seeks to see how user experience and adaptive learning are obtained from this game. The research method uses neuroresearch. The results of the study show that the user experience is determined by the interest in the game. While the interest in being a pro player is a determining factor for players experiencing adaptive learning. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Adaptive learning; game; Game players; research methods; User experience; Artificial intelligence
Funding Text 1: This work is partially supported by Research Interest Group In Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University. The authors also gratefully acknowledge the helpful comments and suggestions of the reviewers, which have improved the presentation.
